intro: Prismatomeris robusta, commonly known as the robust prismatomeris, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
